intro: Cordia belizensis, commonly known as the Belize cordia, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by woody, spherical fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
